intro: Dielytra scandens, commonly known as the climbing dielytra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland areas and stream banks. The plant has slender, climbing stems that can reach several meters in length, often twining around other vegetation. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a distinctive reddish or purplish hue on the underside. Dielytra scandens produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters, which are followed by three-lobed seed capsules.
